item.title: Katie add a quote by Willa Cather
item.description: "That is happiness, to be dissolved into something complete and great. " -- Willa Cather

item.title: Katie add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Mercy detached from justice grows unmerciful. " -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Katie add a quote by Marilynne Robinson
item.description: "There is a saying that to understand is to forgive, but that is an error, so Papa used to say. You must forgive in order to understand. Until you forgive, you defend yourself against the possibility of understanding. ... If you forgive, he would say, you may indeed still not understand, but you will be ready to understand, and that is the posture of grace." -- Marilynne Robinson

item.title: Katie add a quote by Walker Percy
Katie add a quote by Wendell Berry
item.description: "She would do a mans work when she needed to, but she lived and died without ever putting on a pair of pants. She wore dresses. Being a widow, she wore them black. Being a woman of her time she wore them long. the girls of her day I think must have been like well wrapped gifts to be opened by their husbands on their wedding night, a complete surprise. 'Well! What's this!?" -- Wendell Berry

item.title: Katie add a quote by George Bernard Shaw
item.description: "Bear it like a man, even if you feel it like an ass. " -- George Bernard Shaw

item.title: Katie add a quote by Wendell Berry
item.description: "A man's life is always dealing with permanence, that is the most dangerous kind of irresponsibility is to think of your doings as temporary." -- Wendell Berry
